post_text:
It’s Friday and we are so excited for our next #ShelbyShowcase! 🎉 This week, we shine our spotlight on Greg Mongold, a high school science teacher.🔬 Keep reading to find out more about Greg and some great advice he has for our students!

𝑯𝒐𝒎𝒆𝒕𝒐𝒘𝒏: Plymouth, Ohio

𝑯𝒐𝒃𝒃𝒊𝒆𝒔: I help out with SHS sports, our local Boy Scout Troop, and enjoy spending time with my sons.

𝑻𝒊𝒎𝒆 𝒘𝒊𝒕𝒉 𝑺𝒉𝒆𝒍𝒃𝒚 𝑪𝒊𝒕𝒚 𝑺𝒄𝒉𝒐𝒐𝒍𝒔: 20 years

𝑴𝒐𝒕𝒊𝒗𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏 𝒇𝒐𝒓 𝒄𝒖𝒓𝒓𝒆𝒏𝒕 𝒓𝒐𝒍𝒆: I love science! ⚗️🧪🧫

𝑭𝒂𝒗𝒐𝒓𝒊𝒕𝒆 𝒔𝒄𝒉𝒐𝒐𝒍 𝒔𝒖𝒃𝒋𝒆𝒄𝒕: Physics. I find the topic simultaneously insightful and challenging.

𝑨𝒅𝒗𝒊𝒄𝒆 𝒇𝒐𝒓 𝒕𝒐𝒅𝒂𝒚'𝒔 𝒔𝒕𝒖𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒔: All life is an experiment. There is no such thing as failure, only results. 🙌

𝑭𝒐𝒏𝒅𝒆𝒔𝒕 𝑺𝒉𝒆𝒍𝒃𝒚 𝒎𝒆𝒎𝒐𝒓𝒚: I have too many fond memories of experiences with students and athletes in the past two decades to pick just one.

𝑾𝒉𝒂𝒕 𝒅𝒐𝒆𝒔 #𝑾𝒉𝒊𝒑𝒑𝒆𝒕𝑷𝒓𝒊𝒅𝒆 𝒎𝒆𝒂𝒏 𝒕𝒐 𝒚𝒐𝒖? We are all in this together. Once a Whippet, always a Whippet. 🐾

Greg, thank you for all you do for our students! We love having you as part of our Shelby family! #WhippetStrong #WhippetPride

𝗪𝗲’𝘃𝗲 𝗴𝗼𝘁 𝘀𝗼𝗺𝗲 𝗴𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁 𝗻𝗲𝘄𝘀! Effective Monday, September 14, all student meal costs are waived through December 31, 2020, or until funds have been exhausted, per the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA). This means breakfast and lunch is now 𝗙𝗥𝗘𝗘 for 𝗔𝗟𝗟 students enrolled at Shelby City Schools, Whippet Academy, Shelby Saint Mary’s, and Sacred Hearts Schools!

🍎 Go to https://tinyurl.com/y6d8d43y for more information regarding Whippet Academy meal pickup.

🥪 Go to https://tinyurl.com/y2nbbee5 for more information regarding this announcement! #WhippetStrong #WhippetPride

post_text:
We are so fortunate to have such a loyal network of Shelby alumni who help keep our traditions alive! 🐾 Today, we want to celebrate a really special alumnus, 𝗚𝗿𝗲𝗴 𝗗𝗮𝗻𝗶𝗲𝗹, a 1971 Shelby High School graduate, who has an absolutely incredible story, that we are proud to be part of. ❤️

Greg was born a partially sighted child and at the age of six became totally blind. He is an incredibly talented musician, and after getting his start in the marching band at Shelby High School, became a member of the 𝑶𝒉𝒊𝒐 𝑺𝒕𝒂𝒕𝒆 𝑴𝒂𝒓𝒄𝒉𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝑩𝒂𝒏𝒅 from 1971-1974. ⭕🙌 He has paved the way and opened doors for members of this prestigious marching band who may have otherwise been overlooked.

Greg is a true inspiration to all! We welcome you to watch his full story at https://tinyurl.com/y3z33w5g! 🎺 #WhippetStrong #WhippetPride

post_text:
Join us in welcoming 𝗗𝗮𝗸𝗼𝘁𝗮 𝗚𝗿𝗼𝘀𝘀𝗰𝘂𝗽 to our Shelby family! 👏 Dakota is a 2014 Whippet alum and is now a high school Whippet Academy teacher!

Dakota had this to say about his new journey as a Shelby teacher:

“𝘌𝘹𝘤𝘪𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘨𝘦𝘵 𝘮𝘺 𝘧𝘪𝘳𝘴𝘵 𝘵𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘰𝘱𝘱𝘰𝘳𝘵𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘪𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘴𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭 𝘥𝘪𝘴𝘵𝘳𝘪𝘤𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘩𝘦𝘭𝘱𝘦𝘥 𝘳𝘢𝘪𝘴𝘦 𝘮𝘦 𝘪𝘯𝘵𝘰 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘴𝘰𝘯 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘵𝘰𝘥𝘢𝘺.”

Welcome back Dakota - we are so excited to have you! 🐾 #WhippetStrong #WhippetPride

Welcome back Dakota - we are so excited to have you! 🐾 #WhippetStrong #WhippetPride

post_text:
Happy Friday! 🙌 Today’s #ShelbyShowcase features John Gies, principal of Shelby High School! We couldn’t agree more with his thoughts on defining what #WhippetPride means to him! 🐾

𝑹𝒐𝒍𝒆: Principal at Shelby High School

𝑯𝒐𝒎𝒆𝒕𝒐𝒘𝒏: Shelby, Ohio 🎉

𝑯𝒐𝒃𝒃𝒊𝒆𝒔: Love to fly fish, read and be with family. 🎣

𝑻𝒊𝒎𝒆 𝒘𝒊𝒕𝒉 𝑺𝒉𝒆𝒍𝒃𝒚 𝑪𝒊𝒕𝒚 𝑺𝒄𝒉𝒐𝒐𝒍𝒔: 18 years

𝑴𝒐𝒕𝒊𝒗𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏 𝒇𝒐𝒓 𝒄𝒖𝒓𝒓𝒆𝒏𝒕 𝒓𝒐𝒍𝒆: I’ve always wanted to be a teacher and after about 10 years in the classroom I felt that administration was the next logical step in my career.

𝑭𝒂𝒗𝒐𝒓𝒊𝒕𝒆 𝒔𝒄𝒉𝒐𝒐𝒍 𝒔𝒖𝒃𝒋𝒆𝒄𝒕: Any social studies class. I have loved reading and history since the seventh grade. 📖

𝑨𝒅𝒗𝒊𝒄𝒆 𝒇𝒐𝒓 𝒕𝒐𝒅𝒂𝒚'𝒔 𝒔𝒕𝒖𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒔: Don't do something today that your future self would be embarrassed about.

𝑭𝒐𝒏𝒅𝒆𝒔𝒕 𝑺𝒉𝒆𝒍𝒃𝒚 𝒎𝒆𝒎𝒐𝒓𝒚: Opening the new high school.

𝑾𝒉𝒂𝒕 𝒅𝒐𝒆𝒔 #𝑾𝒉𝒊𝒑𝒑𝒆𝒕𝑷𝒓𝒊𝒅𝒆 𝒎𝒆𝒂𝒏 𝒕𝒐 𝒚𝒐𝒖? Having a tremendous amount of pride in our district, our town and in our staff and students. 👏

John, we are so grateful to have you as a loyal leader in our district and to guide our students on their education journey. Thank you for all you do! ❤️ #WhippetStrong

post_text:
We have another new staff member to celebrate - 𝗞𝗮𝘁𝗹𝘆𝗻 𝗛𝘂𝗹𝗶𝘁! 🎉 Katlyn is originally from Mansfield, graduated from Crestview High School and will be Auburn Elementary’s new speech therapist! Keep reading to see what she had to say about becoming a Whippet! 🐾

“𝘐’𝘮 𝘴𝘰 𝘦𝘹𝘤𝘪𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦 𝘱𝘢𝘳𝘵 𝘰𝘧 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘚𝘩𝘦𝘭𝘣𝘺 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘮𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘴𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭 𝘥𝘪𝘴𝘵𝘳𝘪𝘤𝘵! 𝘚𝘩𝘦𝘭𝘣𝘺 𝘤𝘢𝘳𝘦𝘴 𝘢𝘣𝘰𝘶𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘪𝘳 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘦𝘥𝘶𝘤𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯𝘢𝘭 𝘦𝘹𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘦𝘯𝘤𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘺 𝘳𝘦𝘤𝘦𝘪𝘷𝘦. 𝘔𝘺 𝘧𝘦𝘭𝘭𝘰𝘸 𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘧𝘧 𝘩𝘢𝘷𝘦 𝘣𝘦𝘦𝘯 𝘴𝘰 𝘸𝘦𝘭𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘩𝘦𝘭𝘱𝘧𝘶𝘭 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘮𝘺 𝘵𝘳𝘢𝘯𝘴𝘪𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯 𝘪𝘯𝘵𝘰 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘥𝘪𝘴𝘵𝘳𝘪𝘤𝘵. 𝘐'𝘮 𝘭𝘰𝘰𝘬𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘧𝘰𝘳𝘸𝘢𝘳𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘱𝘢𝘳𝘵 𝘰𝘧 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘮𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘺!”

Katlyn, WE are looking forward to having YOU as part of our Shelby community! Welcome! 😀 #WhippetStrong #WhippetPride
text:
We have another new staff member to celebrate - 𝗞𝗮𝘁𝗹𝘆𝗻 𝗛𝘂𝗹𝗶𝘁! 🎉 Katlyn is originally from Mansfield, graduated from Crestview High School and will be Auburn Elementary’s new speech therapist! Keep reading to see what she had to say about becoming a Whippet! 🐾

“𝘐’𝘮 𝘴𝘰 𝘦𝘹𝘤𝘪𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦 𝘱𝘢𝘳𝘵 𝘰𝘧 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘚𝘩𝘦𝘭𝘣𝘺 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘮𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘴𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭 𝘥𝘪𝘴𝘵𝘳𝘪𝘤𝘵! 𝘚𝘩𝘦𝘭𝘣𝘺 𝘤𝘢𝘳𝘦𝘴 𝘢𝘣𝘰𝘶𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘪𝘳 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘦𝘥𝘶𝘤𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯𝘢𝘭 𝘦𝘹𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘦𝘯𝘤𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘺 𝘳𝘦𝘤𝘦𝘪𝘷𝘦. 𝘔𝘺 𝘧𝘦𝘭𝘭𝘰𝘸 𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘧𝘧 𝘩𝘢𝘷𝘦 𝘣𝘦𝘦𝘯 𝘴𝘰 𝘸𝘦𝘭𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘩𝘦𝘭𝘱𝘧𝘶𝘭 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘮𝘺 𝘵𝘳𝘢𝘯𝘴𝘪𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯 𝘪𝘯𝘵𝘰 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘥𝘪𝘴𝘵𝘳𝘪𝘤𝘵. 𝘐'𝘮 𝘭𝘰𝘰𝘬𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘧𝘰𝘳𝘸𝘢𝘳𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘱𝘢𝘳𝘵 𝘰𝘧 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘮𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘺!”

Katlyn, WE are looking forward to having YOU as part of our Shelby community! Welcome! 😀 #WhippetStrong #WhippetPride

post_text: Our Whippet Academy students are back in action and excited to start the school year! 🐾 #WhippetStrong #WhippetPride
text: Our Whippet Academy students are back in action and excited to start the school year! 🐾 #WhippetStrong #WhippetPride

post_text: The school year is off to a great start and we want you to hear from our amazing staff! 🤩 In our #WhippetStrong series, you will have the opportunity to hear what our teachers hopes are for the 2020-2021 school year. First up, we welcome you to watch Shelby Middle School teachers 𝗞𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗲 𝗦𝗲𝗶𝗯𝗲𝗿𝘁 and 𝗪𝗵𝗶𝘁𝗻𝗲𝘆 𝗖𝗼𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗻𝘀! We appreciate our teachers and the HUGE part they play in the education and safety of our students! #WhippetPride
text: The school year is off to a great start and we want you to hear from our amazing staff! 🤩 In our #WhippetStrong series, you will have the opportunity to hear what our teachers hopes are for the 2020-2021 school year. First up, we welcome you to watch Shelby Middle School teachers 𝗞𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗲 𝗦𝗲𝗶𝗯𝗲𝗿𝘁 and 𝗪𝗵𝗶𝘁𝗻𝗲𝘆 𝗖𝗼𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗻𝘀! We appreciate our teachers and the HUGE part they play in the education and safety of our students! #WhippetPride

post_text:
Join us in welcoming 𝗔𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗲 𝗨𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴𝗲𝗿! 👏 Allie, graduated from Shelby in 2016 and is returning to teach kindergarten and first-grade at Auburn Elementary and Little Whippets Preschool! She is thrilled to be back and we can’t wait to see her in the classroom!

“𝘐’𝘮 𝘦𝘹𝘤𝘪𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘦 𝘢 𝘚𝘩𝘦𝘭𝘣𝘺 𝘞𝘩𝘪𝘱𝘱𝘦𝘵 𝘢𝘨𝘢𝘪𝘯, 𝘣𝘦𝘤𝘢𝘶𝘴𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘥𝘪𝘴𝘵𝘳𝘪𝘤𝘵 𝘩𝘢𝘴 𝘰𝘧𝘧𝘦𝘳𝘦𝘥 𝘮𝘦 𝘮𝘢𝘯𝘺 𝘰𝘱𝘱𝘰𝘳𝘵𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘪𝘦𝘴 𝘢𝘴 𝘢 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵, 𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘧𝘰𝘳𝘮𝘦𝘳, 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘢𝘵𝘩𝘭𝘦𝘵𝘦 𝘸𝘩𝘪𝘤𝘩 𝘴𝘦𝘵 𝘮𝘦 𝘶𝘱 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘮𝘺 𝘴𝘶𝘤𝘤𝘦𝘴𝘴𝘦𝘴 𝘪𝘯 𝘤𝘰𝘭𝘭𝘦𝘨𝘦. 𝘐 𝘩𝘢𝘷𝘦 𝘮𝘢𝘯𝘺 𝘸𝘰𝘯𝘥𝘦𝘳𝘧𝘶𝘭 𝘮𝘦𝘮𝘰𝘳𝘪𝘦𝘴 𝘢𝘴 𝘢 𝘞𝘩𝘪𝘱𝘱𝘦𝘵 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘵𝘰𝘸𝘯 𝘸𝘪𝘭𝘭 𝘢𝘭𝘸𝘢𝘺𝘴 𝘩𝘰𝘭𝘥 𝘢 𝘴𝘱𝘦𝘤𝘪𝘢𝘭 𝘱𝘭𝘢𝘤𝘦 𝘪𝘯 𝘮𝘺 𝘩𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘵. 𝘐 𝘸𝘢𝘯𝘵 𝘵𝘰 𝘨𝘪𝘷𝘦 𝘣𝘢𝘤𝘬 𝘵𝘰 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘮𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘸𝘩𝘰 𝘩𝘢𝘴 𝘨𝘪𝘷𝘦𝘯 𝘮𝘦 𝘴𝘰 𝘮𝘶𝘤𝘩 𝘣𝘶𝘵 𝘮𝘰𝘴𝘵 𝘪𝘮𝘱𝘰𝘳𝘵𝘢𝘯𝘵𝘭𝘺, 𝘐 𝘸𝘢𝘯𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘴𝘦 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴 𝘵𝘰 𝘩𝘢𝘷𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘴𝘢𝘮𝘦 𝘦𝘹𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘦𝘯𝘤𝘦 𝘢𝘴 𝘐 𝘥𝘪𝘥.”

Allie, we loved watching you grow as a student and are proud you chose Shelby City Schools to begin your teaching career! Welcome back! 👩‍🏫 #WhippetStrong #WhippetPride
text:
Join us in welcoming 𝗔𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗲 𝗨𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴𝗲𝗿! 👏 Allie, graduated from Shelby in 2016 and is returning to teach kindergarten and first-grade at Auburn Elementary and Little Whippets Preschool! She is thrilled to be back and we can’t wait to see her in the classroom!

“𝘐’𝘮 𝘦𝘹𝘤𝘪𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘦 𝘢 𝘚𝘩𝘦𝘭𝘣𝘺 𝘞𝘩𝘪𝘱𝘱𝘦𝘵 𝘢𝘨𝘢𝘪𝘯, 𝘣𝘦𝘤𝘢𝘶𝘴𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘥𝘪𝘴𝘵𝘳𝘪𝘤𝘵 𝘩𝘢𝘴 𝘰𝘧𝘧𝘦𝘳𝘦𝘥 𝘮𝘦 𝘮𝘢𝘯𝘺 𝘰𝘱𝘱𝘰𝘳𝘵𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘪𝘦𝘴 𝘢𝘴 𝘢 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵, 𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘧𝘰𝘳𝘮𝘦𝘳, 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘢𝘵𝘩𝘭𝘦𝘵𝘦 𝘸𝘩𝘪𝘤𝘩 𝘴𝘦𝘵 𝘮𝘦 𝘶𝘱 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘮𝘺 𝘴𝘶𝘤𝘤𝘦𝘴𝘴𝘦𝘴 𝘪𝘯 𝘤𝘰𝘭𝘭𝘦𝘨𝘦. 𝘐 𝘩𝘢𝘷𝘦 𝘮𝘢𝘯𝘺 𝘸𝘰𝘯𝘥𝘦𝘳𝘧𝘶𝘭 𝘮𝘦𝘮𝘰𝘳𝘪𝘦𝘴 𝘢𝘴 𝘢 𝘞𝘩𝘪𝘱𝘱𝘦𝘵 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘵𝘰𝘸𝘯 𝘸𝘪𝘭𝘭 𝘢𝘭𝘸𝘢𝘺𝘴 𝘩𝘰𝘭𝘥 𝘢 𝘴𝘱𝘦𝘤𝘪𝘢𝘭 𝘱𝘭𝘢𝘤𝘦 𝘪𝘯 𝘮𝘺 𝘩𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘵. 𝘐 𝘸𝘢𝘯𝘵 𝘵𝘰 𝘨𝘪𝘷𝘦 𝘣𝘢𝘤𝘬 𝘵𝘰 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘮𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘸𝘩𝘰 𝘩𝘢𝘴 𝘨𝘪𝘷𝘦𝘯 𝘮𝘦 𝘴𝘰 𝘮𝘶𝘤𝘩 𝘣𝘶𝘵 𝘮𝘰𝘴𝘵 𝘪𝘮𝘱𝘰𝘳𝘵𝘢𝘯𝘵𝘭𝘺, 𝘐 𝘸𝘢𝘯𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘴𝘦 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴 𝘵𝘰 𝘩𝘢𝘷𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘴𝘢𝘮𝘦 𝘦𝘹𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘦𝘯𝘤𝘦 𝘢𝘴 𝘐 𝘥𝘪𝘥.”

Allie, we loved watching you grow as a student and are proud you chose Shelby City Schools to begin your teaching career! Welcome back! 👩‍🏫 #WhippetStrong #WhippetPride

post_text: Shelby City Schools is seeking substitute teachers for the 2020-2021 school year! If you, or someone you know, has a bachelor’s degree and is looking for a flexible work schedule, this could be a perfect fit! Please contact the Board of Education Office at 419-342-3520 for more information about the position and how to apply. #WhippetStrong #WhippetPride

post_text:
It’s time to start our #ShelbyShowcase again! We are kicking things off with Kate Hlad, a Shelby Whippet Alum! We are loving the nostalgia of her fondest memory. ❤️

𝑹𝒐𝒍𝒆: Kindergarten teacher at Dowds Elementary

𝑻𝒊𝒎𝒆 𝒘𝒊𝒕𝒉 𝑺𝒉𝒆𝒍𝒃𝒚 𝑪𝒊𝒕𝒚 𝑺𝒄𝒉𝒐𝒐𝒍𝒔: 13 years

𝑴𝒐𝒕𝒊𝒗𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏 𝒇𝒐𝒓 𝒄𝒖𝒓𝒓𝒆𝒏𝒕 𝒓𝒐𝒍𝒆: I have a sincere love for young children, and I love to make learning fun, creative and engaging.

𝑭𝒂𝒗𝒐𝒓𝒊𝒕𝒆 𝒔𝒄𝒉𝒐𝒐𝒍 𝒔𝒖𝒃𝒋𝒆𝒄𝒕: I liked English, because I enjoy reading and writing. 📚✍️

𝑨𝒅𝒗𝒊𝒄𝒆 𝒇𝒐𝒓 𝒕𝒐𝒅𝒂𝒚'𝒔 𝒔𝒕𝒖𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒔: Be true to yourself, be the person you were created to be, and do what you love, to the best of your ability.

𝑯𝒐𝒎𝒆𝒕𝒐𝒘𝒏: Shelby, Ohio 🎉

𝑯𝒐𝒃𝒃𝒊𝒆𝒔: I enjoy spending time with my family and dog, Louie. 🐾

𝑭𝒐𝒏𝒅𝒆𝒔𝒕…

post_text:
UPDATE: Great news Whippet fans! This game is game of the week and therefore free on PPV!

Who’s ready for some football?! 🐾🏈 Tomorrow, at 7:00 p.m. our Shelby Whippets take on the Ontario Warriors and we can’t wait to bring home a W! 🙌 With social distancing requirements, tickets are limited. For those who have tickets to attend the game, gates open at 6:00 p.m. There will be no ticket sales at the gate! Masks must be worn at all times.

Don’t have tickets? Go to 👉 https://www.shelbyk12.org/ and under 8/27 click on WMFDsports.com to get Pay Per View (PPV) Live Tickets and stream the game from the comfort of your home! Coach Mahaney has his mask on and he’s ready to go! Go Whippets! #WhippetStrong #WhippetPrid

post_text:
Join us in celebrating another new Shelby City Schools staff member - 𝗖𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗻𝗱𝗿𝗮 𝗠𝗰𝗖𝗮𝗹𝗹! 👏 Cassandra is the Director of Bands and will be assisting with the sixth-eighth grade middle school band. She is from Woodland Park, New Jersey and graduated from Passaic Valley High School in 2013. We loved hearing what she had to say about Shelby! 🐾

“𝘛𝘩𝘦 𝘚𝘩𝘦𝘭𝘣𝘺 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘮𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘩𝘢𝘴 𝘣𝘦𝘦𝘯 𝘴𝘰 𝘸𝘦𝘭𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘪𝘯𝘨. 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘭𝘰𝘷𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘦𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘺 𝘴𝘦𝘤𝘰𝘯𝘥 𝘰𝘧 𝘣𝘦𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘦. 𝘛𝘩𝘦 𝘮𝘢𝘳𝘤𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘣𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘩𝘢𝘥 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘪𝘳 𝘤𝘢𝘮𝘱 𝘢 𝘧𝘦𝘸 𝘸𝘦𝘦𝘬𝘴 𝘢𝘨𝘰, 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴 𝘩𝘢𝘷𝘦 𝘣𝘦𝘦𝘯 𝘪𝘯𝘤𝘳𝘦𝘥𝘪𝘣𝘭𝘦 𝘵𝘰 𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩! 𝘛𝘩𝘦𝘺 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘥𝘦𝘥𝘪𝘤𝘢𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘩𝘢𝘳𝘥𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘪𝘯𝘥𝘪𝘷𝘪𝘥𝘶𝘢𝘭𝘴. 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘢𝘭𝘴𝘰 𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘺 𝘧𝘰𝘳𝘵𝘶𝘯𝘢𝘵𝘦 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦 𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘴𝘶𝘤𝘩 𝘰𝘶𝘵𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘯𝘥𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘢𝘥𝘮𝘪𝘯𝘪𝘴𝘵𝘳𝘢𝘵𝘰𝘳𝘴, 𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘧𝘧, 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘧𝘢𝘤𝘶𝘭𝘵𝘺 𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘦 𝘢𝘵 𝘚𝘩𝘦𝘭𝘣𝘺 𝘊𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘚𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭𝘴. 𝘌𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘺𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘩𝘢𝘴 𝘣𝘦𝘦𝘯 𝘧𝘢𝘯𝘵𝘢𝘴𝘵𝘪𝘤. 𝘐 𝘤𝘢𝘯𝘯𝘰𝘵 𝘸𝘢𝘪𝘵 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘯𝘦𝘸 𝘴𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭 𝘺𝘦𝘢𝘳 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦𝘨𝘪𝘯! 𝘎𝘰 𝘞𝘩𝘪𝘱𝘱𝘦𝘵𝘴!”

Welcome to the Shelby family, Cassandra! We are so excited to have you! 😀 #WhippetStrong #WhippetPride
text:
Join us in celebrating another new Shelby City Schools staff member - 𝗖𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗻𝗱𝗿𝗮 𝗠𝗰𝗖𝗮𝗹𝗹! 👏 Cassandra is the Director of Bands and will be assisting with the sixth-eighth grade middle school band. She is from Woodland Park, New Jersey and graduated from Passaic Valley High School in 2013. We loved hearing what she had to say about Shelby! 🐾

“𝘛𝘩𝘦 𝘚𝘩𝘦𝘭𝘣𝘺 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘮𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘩𝘢𝘴 𝘣𝘦𝘦𝘯 𝘴𝘰 𝘸𝘦𝘭𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘪𝘯𝘨. 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘭𝘰𝘷𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘦𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘺 𝘴𝘦𝘤𝘰𝘯𝘥 𝘰𝘧 𝘣𝘦𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘦. 𝘛𝘩𝘦 𝘮𝘢𝘳𝘤𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘣𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘩𝘢𝘥 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘪𝘳 𝘤𝘢𝘮𝘱 𝘢 𝘧𝘦𝘸 𝘸𝘦𝘦𝘬𝘴 𝘢𝘨𝘰, 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴 𝘩𝘢𝘷𝘦 𝘣𝘦𝘦𝘯 𝘪𝘯𝘤𝘳𝘦𝘥𝘪𝘣𝘭𝘦 𝘵𝘰 𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩! 𝘛𝘩𝘦𝘺 𝘢𝘳𝘦 𝘥𝘦𝘥𝘪𝘤𝘢𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘩𝘢𝘳𝘥𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘪𝘯𝘥𝘪𝘷𝘪𝘥𝘶𝘢𝘭𝘴. 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘢𝘭𝘴𝘰 𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘺 𝘧𝘰𝘳𝘵𝘶𝘯𝘢𝘵𝘦 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦 𝘸𝘰𝘳𝘬𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘸𝘪𝘵𝘩 𝘴𝘶𝘤𝘩 𝘰𝘶𝘵𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘯𝘥𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘢𝘥𝘮𝘪𝘯𝘪𝘴𝘵𝘳𝘢𝘵𝘰𝘳𝘴, 𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘧𝘧, 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘧𝘢𝘤𝘶𝘭𝘵𝘺 𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘦 𝘢𝘵 𝘚𝘩𝘦𝘭𝘣𝘺 𝘊𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘚𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭𝘴. 𝘌𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘺𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘩𝘢𝘴 𝘣𝘦𝘦𝘯 𝘧𝘢𝘯𝘵𝘢𝘴𝘵𝘪𝘤. 𝘐 𝘤𝘢𝘯𝘯𝘰𝘵 𝘸𝘢𝘪𝘵 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘯𝘦𝘸 𝘴𝘤𝘩𝘰𝘰𝘭 𝘺𝘦𝘢𝘳 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦𝘨𝘪𝘯! 𝘎𝘰 𝘞𝘩𝘪𝘱𝘱𝘦𝘵𝘴!”

Welcome to the Shelby family, Cassandra! We are so excited to have you! 😀 #WhippetStrong #WhippetPride

post_text:
We are so excited to introduce 𝗕𝗮𝘆𝗹𝗶𝗲 𝗪𝗵𝗶𝘁𝗲, our new eighth-grade math and algebra I teacher! 🧑‍🏫 Baylie lives in Shelby and graduated from Shelby in 2016. We love hearing what she had to say about the excitement to be a Whippet again! 🐾

“𝘛𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘪𝘴 𝘮𝘺 𝘩𝘰𝘮𝘦𝘵𝘰𝘸𝘯, 𝘴𝘰 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘢𝘭𝘸𝘢𝘺𝘴 𝘩𝘢𝘱𝘱𝘺 𝘸𝘩𝘦𝘯 𝘐 𝘨𝘦𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘰𝘱𝘱𝘰𝘳𝘵𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘵𝘰 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘦 𝘣𝘢𝘤𝘬. 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘺 𝘦𝘹𝘤𝘪𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘢𝘣𝘰𝘶𝘵 𝘨𝘪𝘷𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘣𝘢𝘤𝘬 𝘵𝘰 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘮𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘺! 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘨𝘭𝘢𝘥 𝘐 𝘩𝘢𝘷𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘰𝘱𝘱𝘰𝘳𝘵𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘵𝘰 𝘨𝘪𝘷𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘳𝘰𝘶𝘨𝘩 𝘚𝘩𝘦𝘭𝘣𝘺 𝘢 𝘨𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘵 𝘦𝘥𝘶𝘤𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯, 𝘭𝘪𝘬𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘰𝘯𝘦 𝘐 𝘩𝘢𝘥 𝘸𝘩𝘦𝘯 𝘐 𝘸𝘢𝘴 𝘢 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵. 𝘌𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘺𝘣𝘰𝘥𝘺 𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘦 𝘪𝘴 𝘴𝘰 𝘴𝘶𝘱𝘱𝘰𝘳𝘵𝘪𝘷𝘦 𝘰𝘧 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘢𝘤𝘢𝘥𝘦𝘮𝘪𝘤𝘴 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘢𝘵𝘩𝘭𝘦𝘵𝘪𝘤𝘴. 𝘐 𝘤𝘢𝘯'𝘵 𝘸𝘢𝘪𝘵 𝘵𝘰 𝘴𝘦𝘦 𝘸𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘺𝘦𝘢𝘳 𝘩𝘰𝘭𝘥𝘴 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘶𝘴!”

We can’t wait to see what this year holds for YOU - welcome back! ❤️ #WhippetStrong #WhippetPride
text:
We are so excited to introduce 𝗕𝗮𝘆𝗹𝗶𝗲 𝗪𝗵𝗶𝘁𝗲, our new eighth-grade math and algebra I teacher! 🧑‍🏫 Baylie lives in Shelby and graduated from Shelby in 2016. We love hearing what she had to say about the excitement to be a Whippet again! 🐾

“𝘛𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘪𝘴 𝘮𝘺 𝘩𝘰𝘮𝘦𝘵𝘰𝘸𝘯, 𝘴𝘰 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘢𝘭𝘸𝘢𝘺𝘴 𝘩𝘢𝘱𝘱𝘺 𝘸𝘩𝘦𝘯 𝘐 𝘨𝘦𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘰𝘱𝘱𝘰𝘳𝘵𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘵𝘰 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘦 𝘣𝘢𝘤𝘬. 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘺 𝘦𝘹𝘤𝘪𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘢𝘣𝘰𝘶𝘵 𝘨𝘪𝘷𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘣𝘢𝘤𝘬 𝘵𝘰 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘮𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘺! 𝘐 𝘢𝘮 𝘨𝘭𝘢𝘥 𝘐 𝘩𝘢𝘷𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘰𝘱𝘱𝘰𝘳𝘵𝘶𝘯𝘪𝘵𝘺 𝘵𝘰 𝘨𝘪𝘷𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵𝘴 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘳𝘰𝘶𝘨𝘩 𝘚𝘩𝘦𝘭𝘣𝘺 𝘢 𝘨𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘵 𝘦𝘥𝘶𝘤𝘢𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯, 𝘭𝘪𝘬𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘰𝘯𝘦 𝘐 𝘩𝘢𝘥 𝘸𝘩𝘦𝘯 𝘐 𝘸𝘢𝘴 𝘢 𝘴𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦𝘯𝘵. 𝘌𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘺𝘣𝘰𝘥𝘺 𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘦 𝘪𝘴 𝘴𝘰 𝘴𝘶𝘱𝘱𝘰𝘳𝘵𝘪𝘷𝘦 𝘰𝘧 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘢𝘤𝘢𝘥𝘦𝘮𝘪𝘤𝘴 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘢𝘵𝘩𝘭𝘦𝘵𝘪𝘤𝘴. 𝘐 𝘤𝘢𝘯'𝘵 𝘸𝘢𝘪𝘵 𝘵𝘰 𝘴𝘦𝘦 𝘸𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘺𝘦𝘢𝘳 𝘩𝘰𝘭𝘥𝘴 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘶𝘴!”

We can’t wait to see what this year holds for YOU - welcome back! ❤️ #WhippetStrong #WhippetPride

post_text: Welcome back, Whippets! 🐾 Today is the first day of school - an opportunity for a fresh start and another year of learning and fun! We wish all of our students, staff and teachers a wonderful school year! ❤️ #WhippetStrong #WhippetPride
text: Welcome back, Whippets! 🐾 Today is the first day of school - an opportunity for a fresh start and another year of learning and fun! We wish all of our students, staff and teachers a wonderful school year! ❤️ #WhippetStrong #WhippetPride

post_text: ICYMI - we are so excited to kick off the school year! 🙂 Although our 2019-2020 school year concluded in an unforeseen way, our staff, students and families came together to make it another 𝘴𝘶𝘤𝘤𝘦𝘴𝘴𝘧𝘶𝘭 and 𝘸𝘰𝘯𝘥𝘦𝘳𝘧𝘶𝘭 year - one we will never forget. ❤️ We are full of #WhippetPride as we look back on some of last year's great memories and look forward to making new memories! 🐾 #WhippetStrong
text: ICYMI - we are so excited to kick off the school year! 🙂 Although our 2019-2020 school year concluded in an unforeseen way, our staff, students and families came together to make it another 𝘴𝘶𝘤𝘤𝘦𝘴𝘴𝘧𝘶𝘭 and 𝘸𝘰𝘯𝘥𝘦𝘳𝘧𝘶𝘭 year - one we will never forget. ❤️ We are full of #WhippetPride as we look back on some of last year's great memories and look forward to making new memories! 🐾 #WhippetStrong

text: We are SO excited to see our students tomorrow! 🤩 We know there will be a lot of first day of school pictures and we would love to share in the fun and excitement! Tag #WhippetStrong and if your post is public we can share those sweet memories on our social media pages! 📸 #WhippetPride

post_text:
“𝘼𝙨 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙢𝙖𝙮 𝙠𝙣𝙤𝙬, 𝙧𝙚𝙘𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙡𝙮 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙂𝙤𝙫𝙚𝙧𝙣𝙤𝙧 𝙨𝙝𝙖𝙧𝙚𝙙 𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙙𝙞𝙧𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙞𝙫𝙚𝙨 𝙧𝙚𝙜𝙖𝙧𝙙𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙨𝙘𝙝𝙤𝙤𝙡 𝙖𝙩𝙝𝙡𝙚𝙩𝙞𝙘𝙨 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙨𝙪𝙗𝙨𝙚𝙦𝙪𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙡𝙮, 𝙖𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙩𝙞𝙢𝙚, 𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙖𝙩𝙝𝙡𝙚𝙩𝙞𝙘 𝙙𝙞𝙧𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙤𝙧𝙨, 𝙥𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙘𝙞𝙥𝙖𝙡𝙨 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙙𝙞𝙨𝙩𝙧𝙞𝙘𝙩 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙙𝙚𝙧𝙨𝙝𝙞𝙥 𝙖𝙧𝙚 𝙬𝙤𝙧𝙠𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙩𝙝𝙧𝙤𝙪𝙜𝙝 𝙙𝙚𝙩𝙖𝙞𝙡𝙨 𝙧𝙚𝙜𝙖𝙧𝙙𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙨𝙥𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙖𝙩𝙤𝙧 𝙖𝙩𝙩𝙚𝙣𝙙𝙖𝙣𝙘𝙚.”

Go to 👉https://tinyurl.com/y2s64llu to view the entire update from Superintendent Tim Tarvin. #WhippetStrong #WhippetPride

post_text: Let’s spread some JOY! ❤️ We want to get creative and inspire our students and staff by participating in 𝐂𝐡𝐚𝐥𝐤 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐖𝐚𝐥𝐤 this weekend! 🌈 Stop by your school and chalk an optimistic message or piece of art to brighten our walkways and entrances. ☀️ Make sure to share your pictures, and if your post is public tag #WhippetStrong for a chance to be featured on our social media pages. We can’t wait to see your masterpieces! 😃 #WhippetPride

post_text:
“We are excited for this school year, despite the challenges ahead!” ~Assistant Superintendent Paul Walker

As we approach the start of school, we know there still may be questions about our online learning platform, Whippet Academy. We invite you to learn more by watching Assistant Superintendent Paul Walker discuss some of the details. For more information, refer to the FAQ available at https://tinyurl.com/y6ckz7ju. “We’ve got this - go Whippets!”🐾 #WhippetStrong #WhippetPride

post_text:
𝗜𝗠𝗣𝗢𝗥𝗧𝗔𝗡𝗧 𝗨𝗣𝗗𝗔𝗧𝗘❗

The first day of school has 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗻𝗴𝗲𝗱 to 𝗠𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗮𝘆, 𝗔𝘂𝗴𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝟮𝟰, 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬 for grades 1 through 12. Kindergarten and preschool information is below:

𝗔𝘂𝗴𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝟮𝟱, 𝟮𝟲, 𝟮𝟳, 𝟮𝟴 - kindergarten rotation schedule for early instruction - Jump Start
𝗔𝘂𝗴𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝟯𝟭 - start date for ALL kindergarten and preschool students

This information has also been sent via email. We are looking forward to the start of our 2020-2021 school year! #WhippetPride

🗣️ 𝗜𝗠𝗣𝗢𝗥𝗧𝗔𝗡𝗧 𝗨𝗣𝗗𝗔𝗧𝗘:

Shelby families - we’ve once again 𝗘𝗫𝗧𝗘𝗡𝗗𝗘𝗗 our survey deadline to 𝟰:𝟬𝟬 𝗽.𝗺. 𝗻𝗲𝘅𝘁 𝗙𝗿𝗶𝗱𝗮𝘆, 𝗝𝘂𝗹𝘆 𝟯𝟭. Please complete the survey ➡️ http://shelbyk12.org/restart-survey and ensure you submit a survey response for EACH child in your family who is enrolled at Shelby City Schools.

post_text:
Today, Thursday, July 2, 2020, Governor DeWine announced back to school health and safety guidelines for all school districts across Ohio. The Shelby City School District is currently reviewing those guidelines.

Our school district has been planning and preparing for multiple scenarios to safely welcome students and staff back.

We will be reviewing the latest information from the governor so we can meet the requirements set forth in these guidelines. Once we know more, we will share more details. #WhippetPride

post_text: It’s officially the last day of school and we want to take a moment to reflect on another wonderful school year!❤️ While no one could’ve predicted how this school year would end, we are filled with #WhippetPride at how quickly our staff, students and families came together while being apart. ⓉⒽⒶⓃⓀ ⓎⓄⓊ ⓈⒽⒺⓁⒷⓎ ⓌⒽⒾⓅⓅⒺⓉⓈ for a memorable year! Enjoy your summer break!😎

post_text: ConⒼⓇⒶⒹulations 𝗦𝗛𝗘𝗟𝗕𝗬 𝗛𝗜𝗚𝗛 𝗦𝗖𝗛𝗢𝗢𝗟 𝗖𝗟𝗔𝗦𝗦 𝗢𝗙 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬!🎓📜 Today is YOUR day - a day to celebrate all of your accomplishments, hard work, diligence and dedication to your education over the last 13 years. It may not look or feel like we had imagined, but it is truly a day that will never be forgotten. With love and pride, we wish all of you the best of luck in your future and a memorable celebration for your well deserved success!🎉❤️🐾 #WhippetPride

May 8 at 3:00 PM ·

We are so proud of our 🎓𝗦𝗛𝗘𝗟𝗕𝗬 𝗛𝗜𝗚𝗛 𝗦𝗖𝗛𝗢𝗢𝗟 𝗖𝗟𝗔𝗦𝗦 𝗢𝗙 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬!🎓 Your hard work and dedication over the years has not gone unnoticed and we want to celebrate each and every one of you during this momentous occasion!

post_text:
See any familiar faces?!👀😀 Our students aren’t the only ones continuing their education from home - our staff is also focusing on their own professional development!

Shelby City Schools has partnered with 𝙇𝙚𝙖𝙙𝙚𝙧 𝙄𝙣 𝙈𝙚, an evidence based Social Emotional Learning (SEL) process that will help support our district, staff, students and community as we face challenges together. This is especially timely with the pandemic. Throughout the month of May, our staff will be participating in six Zoom training sessions, with a focus on 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝟳 𝗛𝗮𝗯𝗶𝘁𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝗛𝗶𝗴𝗵𝗹𝘆 𝗘𝗳𝗳𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗣𝗲𝗼𝗽𝗹𝗲.

We appreciate our staff for continuing to show how much they care by going above and beyond for our students!❤️ #WhippetPride

post_text: May is 𝙈𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙖𝙡 𝙃𝙚𝙖𝙡𝙩𝙝 𝘼𝙬𝙖𝙧𝙚𝙣𝙚𝙨𝙨 𝙈𝙤𝙣𝙩𝙝 and today, Miss Fairchild will take you through how to be kind to the most important person of all - YOURSELF!❤️ She will discuss self care strategies and read the book, 𝙃𝙚𝙡𝙥𝙛𝙪𝙡 𝙉𝙞𝙣𝙟𝙖, by Mary Nhin - a story about self love. Then take you through a presentation that gives examples of strategies to ensure you’re prioritizing mental wellness.⛹️😴☀️✍️ #WellnessWednesday #WhippetPride

post_text:
We are so proud of our 🎓𝗦𝗛𝗘𝗟𝗕𝗬 𝗛𝗜𝗚𝗛 𝗦𝗖𝗛𝗢𝗢𝗟 𝗖𝗟𝗔𝗦𝗦 𝗢𝗙 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬!🎓 Your hard work and dedication over the years has not gone unnoticed and we want to celebrate each and every one of you during this momentous occasion!

Graduation will be held on 𝗦𝗮𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗱𝗮𝘆, 𝗠𝗮𝘆 𝟮𝟯, 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬 𝗮𝘁 𝟭𝟮:𝟬𝟬 𝗽.𝗺. Details about our 2020 Commencement ceremony are included in a letter from Principal, John Gies and Superintendent, Tim Tarvin. Go to ➡️ https://tinyurl.com/ya39z5xj to read the letter. #WhippetPride
text:
We are so proud of our 🎓𝗦𝗛𝗘𝗟𝗕𝗬 𝗛𝗜𝗚𝗛 𝗦𝗖𝗛𝗢𝗢𝗟 𝗖𝗟𝗔𝗦𝗦 𝗢𝗙 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬!🎓 Your hard work and dedication over the years has not gone unnoticed and we want to celebrate each and every one of you during this momentous occasion!

Graduation will be held on 𝗦𝗮𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗱𝗮𝘆, 𝗠𝗮𝘆 𝟮𝟯, 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬 𝗮𝘁 𝟭𝟮:𝟬𝟬 𝗽.𝗺. Details about our 2020 Commencement ceremony are included in a letter from Principal, John Gies and Superintendent, Tim Tarvin. Go to ➡️ https://tinyurl.com/ya39z5xj to read the letter. #WhippetPride

post_text: We want to conclude our ✏️𝗧𝗲𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗿 𝗔𝗽𝗽𝗿𝗲𝗰𝗶𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗪𝗲𝗲𝗸✏️ with messages from our students, parents and community members about any recent times our teachers have brought joy, made things a little easier, or helped us during this recent journey. To all of our Shelby teachers - thank you for all you do - you’re always a 5 ⭐️ rating in our book!❤️🐾 #ThankATeacher #WhippetPride

post_text:
“In a world where you can be anything, be kind.”❤️ -Unknown

Miss Fairchild is back to take us through a wonderful lesson about being kind and cheering others up during times that can seem uncertain and a little overwhelming. She’ll read the book, 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝘽𝙧𝙚𝙖𝙠𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙉𝙚𝙬𝙨, by Sarah Lynne Reul, a story about making things better in big and small ways.📚 A great reminder that being kind is a small act that makes everyone feel good!😀 #WellnessWednesday #WhippetPride

post_text: Our Dowds Elementary teachers received a heartwarming gift from their students for National Teacher Day!❤️ It doesn’t get much sweeter and there’s no better reward than seeing those tiny faces show their virtual appreciation for their teachers who have made such a big impact on their lives! #ThankATeacher #TeacherDay2020 #WhippetPride

post_text:
Yesterday, students at Dowds Elementary participated in their first day of their 𝗖𝗼𝗹𝗹𝗲𝗴𝗲 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗖𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗲𝗿 𝗪𝗲𝗲𝗸 𝗦𝗽𝗶𝗿𝗶𝘁 𝗗𝗮𝘆𝘀!🎉 The theme was, “Our Futures Are Bright,” and they wore bright colors or sunglasses! 🌈😎☀️ If you have a student at Dowds Elementary, don’t miss out on the fun themes for the rest of the week:

🍎 Tuesday- National Teacher Day- dress like a teacher!
🎓 Wednesday- College Gear Day - wear college gear or colors!
👮 Thursday- Future Me Day - dress up as your future career!
🐾 Friday- Whippets Dive Into Their Futures - wear your Shelby gear!

You can share photos📸on social media and include #WhippetPride on your public post so we can feature them on our social media pages!

post_text: Take a look at these well ARTiculated recycled material projects!♻️ Our students were inspired by Angela Haseltine Pozzi and her Washed Ashore project, a non-profit community project to help educate about plastic waste in our oceans and waterways.🌊 Students were encouraged to create an animal using any material that could be recycled or simply be reused!🐢🐞🦉 We are so impressed with the results - great job! #WhippetPride
text: Take a look at these well ARTiculated recycled material projects!♻️ Our students were inspired by Angela Haseltine Pozzi and her Washed Ashore project, a non-profit community project to help educate about plastic waste in our oceans and waterways.🌊 Students were encouraged to create an animal using any material that could be recycled or simply be reused!🐢🐞🦉 We are so impressed with the results - great job! #WhippetPride

post_text:
Teaching is a true work of HEART❤️ and this week we want to express our gratitude with a HUGE virtual 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙣𝙠 𝙮𝙤𝙪 during 𝗧𝗲𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗿 𝗔𝗽𝗽𝗿𝗲𝗰𝗶𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗪𝗲𝗲𝗸!🍎✏️ We are always grateful for our teachers, but with our students currently learning from home, they’ve gone above and beyond to modify their lesson plans and adapt to distance learning. Their commitment to our students and parents during this time has been truly inspiring!

We want to hear from YOU👇 - what’s one thing you’ve recently learned about the work that our teachers do? #ThankATeacher #TeacherAppreciationWeek #WhippetPride

post_text: Mrs. Hummel’s here to remind us that group work is FUN!❤️ We can’t wait to see our students collaborating and researching together again, but in the meantime, take a look at this sweet memory of our fourth-grade students presenting on the topic, 𝙒𝙝𝙮 𝙙𝙤 𝙬𝙧𝙞𝙩𝙚𝙧𝙨 𝙪𝙨𝙚 𝙛𝙞𝙜𝙪𝙧𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙫𝙚 𝙡𝙖𝙣𝙜𝙪𝙖𝙜𝙚?✍️ #WhippetPride

post_text: It’s #WellnessWednesday and Mrs. Eyring is back with some great tips on how to help regulate emotions!😊😢😠 She’ll take you through what it means to be in the blue, yellow and red zone and give great recommendations on how to calm down in a constructive and healthy way.🤗 Then she’ll read, 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙒𝙖𝙮 𝙄 𝙁𝙚𝙚𝙡, by Janan Cain - a great story about children experiencing a range of emotions! #WhippetPride

post_text: This lesson is DINO-MITE!🦖 Mrs. Mullet creates read alouds for her class and last week she read, 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝘽𝙤𝙭𝙘𝙖𝙧 𝘾𝙝𝙞𝙡𝙙𝙧𝙚𝙣 - 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝘿𝙞𝙣𝙤𝙨𝙖𝙪𝙧 𝙈𝙮𝙨𝙩𝙚𝙧𝙮, by Gertrude Chandler Warner. She sent dinosaur bobbleheads to her students to assemble and color to go along with the book.🦕 Those smiles tell us they really enjoyed this project!😄 #WhippetPride

post_text: What a ⓢⓦⓔⓔⓣ lesson!🍬 Mrs. Mullet’s third-grade students were challenged to make rock candy as part of a science project. They followed a recipe and patiently waited for the sugar crystals to form. What a fun and tasty experiment! #WhippetPride

post_text: An advanced placement biology student at Shelby High School, created quite the project! As part of a virus unit, this student leveraged an online presentation maker and a rubric to create an infographic on a topic of his choice. We are very impressed with his skills and the outcome of this project!👍 #WhippetPride

post_text: We love seeing our students having fun and learning with their families!😃 Wyatt, a kindergarten student in Mrs. Hlad’s class acted out the fairy tale, 𝙏𝙝𝙧𝙚𝙚 𝘽𝙞𝙡𝙡𝙮 𝙂𝙤𝙖𝙩𝙨 𝙂𝙧𝙪𝙛𝙛,🐐 with his dad and brother using stick puppets and magna-tiles! #WhippetPride

post_text: Miss Tammy’s students are summoning spring by making 3-D flowers and as of late, we all know we could use a little more spring and bright flowers!🙌🌺 They also learned about the lifecycle of butterflies complete with a butterfly sun catcher.☀️🦋 What a fun lesson! #WhippetPride

post_text: We ❤️ our Shelby seniors! Alyssa Mitchell, is a second year American Sign Language (ASL) student in our distance learning partnership with Ohio School for the Deaf in Columbus, Ohio. To earn her ASL honors cord, she had to complete five hours of community service to benefit the deaf/hard of hearing community. She made several videos that have been shared with some of our Shelby students. Alyssa, we are so proud of your accomplishments and for being part of our Class of 2020!🤟🎓 #WhippetPride
text: We ❤️ our Shelby seniors! Alyssa Mitchell, is a second year American Sign Language (ASL) student in our distance learning partnership with Ohio School for the Deaf in Columbus, Ohio. To earn her ASL honors cord, she had to complete five hours of community service to benefit the deaf/hard of hearing community. She made several videos that have been shared with some of our Shelby students. Alyssa, we are so proud of your accomplishments and for being part of our Class of 2020!🤟🎓 #WhippetPride

post_text: Today’s #TBT captures this crew excitedly preparing to play their Homecoming game against Galion in 1994!🏈 “Clear eyes, full hearts, can’t lose.” -Friday Night Lights #WhippetPride

post_text:
“𝗢𝗻 𝗠𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗮𝘆, 𝗔𝗽𝗿𝗶𝗹 𝟮𝟬, 𝗚𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗻𝗼𝗿 𝗗𝗲𝗪𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝗮𝗻𝗻𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗰𝗲𝗱 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗲 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘄𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝘂𝗲 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗲𝗻𝗱 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹 𝘆𝗲𝗮𝗿. 𝗢𝗳 𝗰𝗼𝘂𝗿𝘀𝗲, 𝘄𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗦𝗵𝗲𝗹𝗯𝘆 𝗖𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘀𝗮𝗱𝗱𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗱 𝗯𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗻𝗲𝘄𝘀, 𝗯𝘂𝘁 𝘄𝗲 𝗮𝗹𝘀𝗼 𝘂𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝗼𝗳 𝘂𝘀 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗰𝗼𝗹𝗹𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝘂𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗱𝗼 𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗽𝗮𝗿𝘁 𝘁𝗼 𝗸𝗲𝗲𝗽 𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀, 𝗻𝗲𝗶𝗴𝗵𝗯𝗼𝗿𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗹𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗱 𝗼𝗻𝗲𝘀 𝘀𝗮𝗳𝗲. 𝗢𝗳 𝗰𝗼𝘂𝗿𝘀𝗲, 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗯𝗶𝗴 𝗾𝘂𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗶𝘀, 𝘄𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗱𝗼𝗲𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹 𝘆𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗹𝗼𝗼𝗸 𝗹𝗶𝗸𝗲?”

To read this important update from Superintendent, Tim Tarvin go to👉 https://www.shelbyk12.org/. #WhippetPride
text:
“𝗢𝗻 𝗠𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗮𝘆, 𝗔𝗽𝗿𝗶𝗹 𝟮𝟬, 𝗚𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗻𝗼𝗿 𝗗𝗲𝗪𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝗮𝗻𝗻𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗰𝗲𝗱 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗿𝗲𝗺𝗼𝘁𝗲 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗻𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘄𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝘂𝗲 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗲𝗻𝗱 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹 𝘆𝗲𝗮𝗿. 𝗢𝗳 𝗰𝗼𝘂𝗿𝘀𝗲, 𝘄𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗦𝗵𝗲𝗹𝗯𝘆 𝗖𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝘀𝗮𝗱𝗱𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗱 𝗯𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗻𝗲𝘄𝘀, 𝗯𝘂𝘁 𝘄𝗲 𝗮𝗹𝘀𝗼 𝘂𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝗼𝗳 𝘂𝘀 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗰𝗼𝗹𝗹𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲𝗹𝘆 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗻𝘂𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗱𝗼 𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗽𝗮𝗿𝘁 𝘁𝗼 𝗸𝗲𝗲𝗽 𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘀𝘁𝘂𝗱𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀, 𝗻𝗲𝗶𝗴𝗵𝗯𝗼𝗿𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗹𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗱 𝗼𝗻𝗲𝘀 𝘀𝗮𝗳𝗲. 𝗢𝗳 𝗰𝗼𝘂𝗿𝘀𝗲, 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗯𝗶𝗴 𝗾𝘂𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗶𝘀, 𝘄𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗱𝗼𝗲𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹 𝘆𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝗹𝗼𝗼𝗸 𝗹𝗶𝗸𝗲?”

To read this important update from Superintendent, Tim Tarvin go to👉 https://www.shelbyk12.org/. #WhippetPride

post_text:
**** Special Update ****

Per Governor Mike DeWine’s announcement this afternoon, Ohio schools will continue with emergency remote learning for the remainder of the current academic year due to COVID-19.

We know there will be many questions as a result of this announcement; we are working quickly to address those, as well as identify alternative solutions for the impacts of this decision. In the meantime, we appreciate all of you for your ongoing support as we work through this together. #WhippetPride #InThisTogetherOhio

post_text:
Raise your hand🙋‍♀️ if you have #WhippetPride for our Shelby seniors!🐾 We want to celebrate our seniors and all of their wonderful accomplishments throughout their educational journeys. You can join us in showing your support by updating your Facebook profile with a Class of 2020 frame.🎓

If you don’t already, please 𝙡𝙞𝙠𝙚👍 our Facebook page and follow these easy directions.

𝙁𝙧𝙤𝙢 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙙𝙚𝙨𝙠𝙩𝙤𝙥 🖥️:
▪️ Go to Facebook
▪️ Hover over your profile picture and click “Update”
▪️ Under Frames, click on the frame that you would like to use
▪️ Drag your picture to reposition, if necessary
▪️ Click “Use as Profile Picture”

𝙁𝙧𝙤𝙢 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙢𝙤𝙗𝙞𝙡𝙚 𝙥𝙝𝙤𝙣𝙚📱:
▪️ Go to Facebook
▪️ Click on your profile picture
▪️ Click “Add Frame”
▪️ Choose the frame that you would like
▪️ Click “Edit Frames or Make Temporary” if you choose to make other updates
▪️ Click “Save”

We can’t wait to honor and applaud our hardworking seniors!👏 #WhippetPride

post_text:
As we continue on our virtual learning journey, Jami Gilger, second-grade teacher at Dowds Elementary, has GREAT advice for our students, parents and teachers. We appreciate what she shared and completely agree!💯🙌 #WhippetPride

“𝙀𝙫𝙚𝙧𝙮 𝙥𝙚𝙧𝙨𝙤𝙣 𝙘𝙤𝙢𝙚𝙨 𝙩𝙤 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙚𝙭𝙥𝙚𝙧𝙞𝙚𝙣𝙘𝙚 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝 𝙖 𝙙𝙞𝙛𝙛𝙚𝙧𝙚𝙣𝙩, 𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙦𝙪𝙚 𝙨𝙞𝙩𝙪𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣. 𝙁𝙞𝙣𝙙 𝙬𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙚𝙣𝙟𝙤𝙮 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙘𝙖𝙧𝙫𝙚 𝙤𝙪𝙩 𝙩𝙞𝙢𝙚 𝙩𝙤 𝙩𝙖𝙠𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙧𝙚 𝙤𝙛 𝙔𝙊𝙐, 𝙢𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙖𝙡𝙡𝙮, 𝙥𝙝𝙮𝙨𝙞𝙘𝙖𝙡𝙡𝙮 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙨𝙤𝙘𝙞𝙖𝙡𝙡𝙮. 𝙔𝙚𝙨, 𝙞𝙩 𝙢𝙞𝙜𝙝𝙩 𝙡𝙤𝙤𝙠 𝙙𝙞𝙛𝙛𝙚𝙧𝙚𝙣𝙩 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙮𝙚𝙨, 𝙞𝙩 𝙢𝙞𝙜𝙝𝙩 𝙣𝙤𝙩 𝙖𝙡𝙬𝙖𝙮𝙨 𝙗𝙚 𝙞𝙙𝙚𝙖𝙡, 𝙗𝙪𝙩 𝙄 𝙠𝙣𝙤𝙬 𝙥𝙚𝙧𝙨𝙤𝙣𝙖𝙡𝙡𝙮 𝙄 𝙝𝙖𝙫𝙚 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙣𝙚𝙙 𝙩𝙝𝙧𝙤𝙪𝙜𝙝 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙘𝙝𝙖𝙣𝙜𝙚. 𝙊𝙣𝙚 - 𝙄 𝙘𝙖𝙣 𝙖𝙙𝙖𝙥𝙩 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖𝙘𝙘𝙚𝙥𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙝𝙖𝙡𝙡𝙚𝙣𝙜𝙚𝙨, 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙩𝙬𝙤 - 𝙄 𝙨𝙪𝙧𝙚 𝙠𝙣𝙤𝙬 𝙄 𝙝𝙖𝙫𝙚 𝙥𝙡𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙮 𝙤𝙛 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣𝙜𝙨 𝙩𝙤 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙣. 𝙇𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙣𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙣𝙚𝙫𝙚𝙧 𝙨𝙩𝙤𝙥𝙨 𝙣𝙤 𝙢𝙖𝙩𝙩𝙚𝙧 𝙝𝙤𝙬 𝙤𝙡𝙙 𝙤𝙧 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙣𝙜 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙖𝙧𝙚.

𝙋𝙖𝙧𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙨, 𝙩𝙖𝙠𝙚 𝙚𝙖𝙘𝙝 𝙙𝙖𝙮 𝙤𝙣𝙚 𝙖𝙩 𝙖 𝙩𝙞𝙢𝙚, 𝙄 𝙠𝙣𝙤𝙬 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙝𝙖𝙨 𝙗𝙚𝙚𝙣 𝙫𝙚𝙧𝙮 𝙙𝙞𝙛𝙛𝙚𝙧𝙚𝙣𝙩 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖𝙩 𝙩𝙞𝙢𝙚𝙨 𝙫𝙚𝙧𝙮 𝙙𝙞𝙛𝙛𝙞𝙘𝙪𝙡𝙩. 𝙄 𝙠𝙣𝙤𝙬 𝙬𝙚 𝙖𝙡𝙡 𝙛𝙚𝙚𝙡 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙛 𝙮𝙤𝙪'𝙧𝙚 𝙙𝙤𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙗𝙚𝙨𝙩 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙘𝙝𝙞𝙡𝙙 𝙞𝙨 𝙧𝙚𝙖𝙙𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙙𝙤𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙬𝙤𝙧𝙠 𝙬𝙚 𝙖𝙧𝙚 𝙝𝙖𝙥𝙥𝙮. 𝙈𝙤𝙨𝙩 𝙤𝙛 𝙖𝙡𝙡 𝙬𝙚 𝙬𝙖𝙣𝙩 𝙩𝙤 𝙏𝙃𝘼𝙉𝙆 𝙔𝙊𝙐 𝙛𝙤𝙧 𝙝𝙚𝙡𝙥𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙘𝙝𝙞𝙡𝙙𝙧𝙚𝙣 𝙗𝙚 𝙨𝙪𝙘𝙘𝙚𝙨𝙨𝙛𝙪𝙡 𝙩𝙝𝙧𝙤𝙪𝙜𝙝 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙘𝙝𝙖𝙣𝙜𝙚. 𝙒𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙧𝙚 𝙖𝙗𝙤𝙪𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙚𝙢, 𝙟𝙪𝙨𝙩 𝙡𝙞𝙠𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙙𝙤, 𝙚𝙢𝙤𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣𝙖𝙡𝙡𝙮 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙚𝙙𝙪𝙘𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣𝙖𝙡𝙡𝙮.”
text:
As we continue on our virtual learning journey, Jami Gilger, second-grade teacher at Dowds Elementary, has GREAT advice for our students, parents and teachers. We appreciate what she shared and completely agree!💯🙌 #WhippetPride

“𝙀𝙫𝙚𝙧𝙮 𝙥𝙚𝙧𝙨𝙤𝙣 𝙘𝙤𝙢𝙚𝙨 𝙩𝙤 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙚𝙭𝙥𝙚𝙧𝙞𝙚𝙣𝙘𝙚 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝 𝙖 𝙙𝙞𝙛𝙛𝙚𝙧𝙚𝙣𝙩, 𝙪𝙣𝙞𝙦𝙪𝙚 𝙨𝙞𝙩𝙪𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣. 𝙁𝙞𝙣𝙙 𝙬𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙚𝙣𝙟𝙤𝙮 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙘𝙖𝙧𝙫𝙚 𝙤𝙪𝙩 𝙩𝙞𝙢𝙚 𝙩𝙤 𝙩𝙖𝙠𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙧𝙚 𝙤𝙛 𝙔𝙊𝙐, 𝙢𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙖𝙡𝙡𝙮, 𝙥𝙝𝙮𝙨𝙞𝙘𝙖𝙡𝙡𝙮 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙨𝙤𝙘𝙞𝙖𝙡𝙡𝙮. 𝙔𝙚𝙨, 𝙞𝙩 𝙢𝙞𝙜𝙝𝙩 𝙡𝙤𝙤𝙠 𝙙𝙞𝙛𝙛𝙚𝙧𝙚𝙣𝙩 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙮𝙚𝙨, 𝙞𝙩 𝙢𝙞𝙜𝙝𝙩 𝙣𝙤𝙩 𝙖𝙡𝙬𝙖𝙮𝙨 𝙗𝙚 𝙞𝙙𝙚𝙖𝙡, 𝙗𝙪𝙩 𝙄 𝙠𝙣𝙤𝙬 𝙥𝙚𝙧𝙨𝙤𝙣𝙖𝙡𝙡𝙮 𝙄 𝙝𝙖𝙫𝙚 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙣𝙚𝙙 𝙩𝙝𝙧𝙤𝙪𝙜𝙝 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙘𝙝𝙖𝙣𝙜𝙚. 𝙊𝙣𝙚 - 𝙄 𝙘𝙖𝙣 𝙖𝙙𝙖𝙥𝙩 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖𝙘𝙘𝙚𝙥𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙘𝙝𝙖𝙡𝙡𝙚𝙣𝙜𝙚𝙨, 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙩𝙬𝙤 - 𝙄 𝙨𝙪𝙧𝙚 𝙠𝙣𝙤𝙬 𝙄 𝙝𝙖𝙫𝙚 𝙥𝙡𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙮 𝙤𝙛 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣𝙜𝙨 𝙩𝙤 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙣. 𝙇𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙣𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙣𝙚𝙫𝙚𝙧 𝙨𝙩𝙤𝙥𝙨 𝙣𝙤 𝙢𝙖𝙩𝙩𝙚𝙧 𝙝𝙤𝙬 𝙤𝙡𝙙 𝙤𝙧 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙣𝙜 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙖𝙧𝙚.

𝙋𝙖𝙧𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙨, 𝙩𝙖𝙠𝙚 𝙚𝙖𝙘𝙝 𝙙𝙖𝙮 𝙤𝙣𝙚 𝙖𝙩 𝙖 𝙩𝙞𝙢𝙚, 𝙄 𝙠𝙣𝙤𝙬 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙝𝙖𝙨 𝙗𝙚𝙚𝙣 𝙫𝙚𝙧𝙮 𝙙𝙞𝙛𝙛𝙚𝙧𝙚𝙣𝙩 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙖𝙩 𝙩𝙞𝙢𝙚𝙨 𝙫𝙚𝙧𝙮 𝙙𝙞𝙛𝙛𝙞𝙘𝙪𝙡𝙩. 𝙄 𝙠𝙣𝙤𝙬 𝙬𝙚 𝙖𝙡𝙡 𝙛𝙚𝙚𝙡 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙛 𝙮𝙤𝙪'𝙧𝙚 𝙙𝙤𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙗𝙚𝙨𝙩 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙘𝙝𝙞𝙡𝙙 𝙞𝙨 𝙧𝙚𝙖𝙙𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙙𝙤𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙬𝙤𝙧𝙠 𝙬𝙚 𝙖𝙧𝙚 𝙝𝙖𝙥𝙥𝙮. 𝙈𝙤𝙨𝙩 𝙤𝙛 𝙖𝙡𝙡 𝙬𝙚 𝙬𝙖𝙣𝙩 𝙩𝙤 𝙏𝙃𝘼𝙉𝙆 𝙔𝙊𝙐 𝙛𝙤𝙧 𝙝𝙚𝙡𝙥𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙘𝙝𝙞𝙡𝙙𝙧𝙚𝙣 𝙗𝙚 𝙨𝙪𝙘𝙘𝙚𝙨𝙨𝙛𝙪𝙡 𝙩𝙝𝙧𝙤𝙪𝙜𝙝 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙨 𝙘𝙝𝙖𝙣𝙜𝙚. 𝙒𝙚 𝙘𝙖𝙧𝙚 𝙖𝙗𝙤𝙪𝙩 𝙩𝙝𝙚𝙢, 𝙟𝙪𝙨𝙩 𝙡𝙞𝙠𝙚 𝙮𝙤𝙪 𝙙𝙤, 𝙚𝙢𝙤𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣𝙖𝙡𝙡𝙮 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙚𝙙𝙪𝙘𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣𝙖𝙡𝙡𝙮.”

“As we all know, Governor DeWine has announced that schools will remain closed through May 1st, and I want to assure students and families that the Shelby City Schools will continue to provide meaningful instruction for the next four weeks just as we have since this closure began on March 16.”

To view the letter and updates on 𝙢𝙚𝙖𝙡 𝙙𝙞𝙨𝙩𝙧𝙞𝙗𝙪𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣 and our 𝙨𝙚𝙣𝙞𝙤𝙧𝙨 𝙪𝙥𝙘𝙤𝙢𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙚𝙫𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙨 go to➡️ https://www.shelbyk12.org/. #WhippetPride

post_text:
***** Special Update *****

Per Governor Mike DeWine’s announcement this afternoon, Ohio schools will continue remote learning through May 1, 2020 in response to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. We want to take this opportunity to thank our entire staff for their hard work, and all of our families for their ongoing support. We will get through this together! #InThisTogetherOhio #WhippetPride

We will get through this together! #InThisTogetherOhio #WhippetPride

post_text:
We are BEARLY🐻 able to contain our excitement about our community bear hunt! 📣Join us in spreading the word to all Shelby residents and businesses that our children will be going on a bear hunt throughout our community while taking walks outside or riding in their parents' vehicles. Please put a teddy bear or two in your front window for them to see! Let’s bring smiles to their sweet faces and place your bears in the window on or before Sunday, March 29!😃🧸

We invite you and your children to prepare for the big day by watching this animated story, 𝙒𝙚'𝙧𝙚 𝙂𝙤𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙤𝙣 𝙖 𝘽𝙚𝙖𝙧 𝙃𝙪𝙣𝙩, by Michael Rosen and Helen Oxenbury at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Waoa3iG3bZ4. #WhippetPride

It’s Virtual Spirit Week! Yesterday, students embraced “sock it to coronavirus” day! 🧦 Take a look at these very festive, creative sock combos and smiles!😄 We love seeing our students and staff unite in these fun, virtual challenges. Don’t miss out on the rest of the challenges listed below!

You can post pictures in the Shelby group pages on Facebook, or email pictures to your teacher to be posted on our district social media! #WhippetPride

❤️ Tuesday: We are all in this together. Dress in rainbow!🌈
❤️ Wednesday: Hats off to emergency/medical workers. Wear your best hat!👒🎩🧢
❤️ Thursday: You don’t have to be six feet away from a good book. Read to a stuffed animal!🧸
❤️ Friday: Proud to be a Whippet. Wear your Shelby gear!🐾

post_text: In honor of Dr. Seuss’ birthday last week, Mrs. Hlad’s kindergarten class had a busy week cooking up some really fun lessons!🍳 They practiced producing their own rhyming words in pretend skillets, they created an edible 𝘾𝙖𝙩 𝙞𝙣 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙃𝙖𝙩, read, 𝙏𝙝𝙚 𝙇𝙤𝙧𝙖𝙭 and sported mustaches,💛 read, 𝘽𝙖𝙧𝙩𝙝𝙤𝙡𝙤𝙢𝙚𝙬 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙩𝙝𝙚 𝙊𝙤𝙗𝙡𝙚𝙘𝙠 and made some green Oobleck of their own!💚 They ate real green eggs and ham, then made a class graph using tally marks to see how many of them liked it or disliked it.👍👎 What an active and fun week of learning! #WhippetPride

post_text: All systems go!🤖 Mrs. Mullet’s third-grade class has been very busy working on STEAM projects and using robots to learn how to code. They’re beginning with basic commands and moving up to more complex robots using iPads and computers.💻 The students are also using LEGOS to build towns and code the trains to perform different tasks. All these materials were purchased through a grant from DonorsChoose! #WhippetPride

post_text: Welcome babies!👶 Congratulations💕💙 and thank you to all the new and expecting parents who attended the Community Baby Shower at Marvin Memorial Library yesterday! This event is a collaborative effort, hosted by, Mid-Ohio Educational Service Center, Marvin Memorial Library, and the reading specialists from Auburn and Dowds Elementary. The purpose is to provide available resources to help support parents in those early stages of infancy, with a focus on early literacy and the impact it has on brain development.📚 What a wonderful way to provide essential information to parents in the community! #WhippetPride

post_text: The votes are in!🗳️ We love this weekly practice in Mrs. Amicone’s 1st grade class at Dowds Elementary. Every Friday, the students vote for a “student of the week,” and that student has special responsibilities for the following week. Some of those include: announcing new jobs, the attendance report, reading a book to the class, checking book baskets and running the election for the next week. What a great way to encourage leadership in the classroom! #WhippetPride

post_text:
We’re excited to introduce our very first #ShelbyShowcase! Each week, we will highlight a staff member and share with you a little bit more about them. Our staff means so much to us and we know how special they are, and now we want to share them with YOU!

This week, we are excited to feature Jessie Huggins who is a 7th grade Intervention Specialist. We LOVE the advice she has for our students!❤️

𝑹𝒐𝒍𝒆: 7th grade Intervention Specialist

𝑻𝒊𝒎𝒆 𝒘𝒊𝒕𝒉 𝑺𝒉𝒆𝒍𝒃𝒚 𝑪𝒊𝒕𝒚 𝑺𝒄𝒉𝒐𝒐𝒍𝒔: 2 years

𝑴𝒐𝒕𝒊𝒗𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏 𝒇𝒐𝒓 𝒄𝒖𝒓𝒓𝒆𝒏𝒕 𝒓𝒐𝒍𝒆: A former coworker suggested I get my Master's in Special Education, while substitute teaching in MD (multiple disabilities) classrooms at Kent City Schools. So I did!

𝑭𝒂𝒗𝒐𝒓𝒊𝒕𝒆 𝒔𝒄𝒉𝒐𝒐𝒍 𝒔𝒖𝒃𝒋𝒆𝒄𝒕: I…

post_text: Last week, in 4th grade guidance lessons at Dowds Elementary, students were taught an invaluable lesson! They not only learned how to be a good citizen, they learned how to be a good 𝗱𝗶𝗴𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹 citizen. They spent time playing a game created by Google called, Interland, which teaches online safety!💻 What an incredibly important topic to start teaching our youth! #WhippetPride

post_text: We spy some future architects! 🏢🏗️ Mrs. Collins 5th grade class put their fine motor skills to use and started their geometry unit by constructing their own buildings. They talked about all the different layers (floors) of their buildings and what they could potentially be used for. Some of those included banks, pet hotels, window companies and customer service centers. What a creative group! #WhippetPride

post_text: A very big congratulations to Delbert Wright, for receiving his SHS diploma! He left high school in 1964 to join the U.S. Army. Mr. Wright is the 21st veteran to receive a SHS diploma after leaving high school before graduating to serve our country. Thank you for your service, Mr. Wright!🇺🇸 #WhippetPride (📷: Courtesy of SHS)

post_text: ♻️It’s 𝗶𝗻𝗰𝗿𝗲𝗱𝗶𝗯𝗹𝗲 how much these middle school students have BIN🚮 recycling!♻️ The EcoWhippets, led by Shelby Middle School teacher Mindy Rowlands, is a recycling club of 35 middle school students that have spread the message that recycling is effortless throughout the community. The EcoWhippets focus on recycling aluminum, paper, tin and plastics. They have successfully prevented 𝟭𝟱,𝟬𝟬𝟬 𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗺𝘀 from going into the landfill! WOW! Awesome job everyone!👏👏 #WhippetPride

post_text:
There is nothing better than our students giving back to our community!🙌 Our 7th grade students from team THINK bought candy grams and crush cans to raise money to deliver care packages to our first responders in the community! They delivered the goodies to Shelby Police Department, OhioHealth and Shelby Firefighters Local 2492. This is wonderful to see and we are so proud! #WhippetPride

Picture📷 1 (L to R): Victor Uyoa, Branson Scott, Macey Parks, and Emma Montgomery

post_text: What better way for students to learn than from each other?!🤩 Miss Huggins 7th grade English Language Arts (ELA) students on team THINK collected textual evidence from the book 𝘛𝘩𝘦 𝘉𝘰𝘺 𝘪𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘚𝘵𝘳𝘪𝘱𝘦𝘥 𝘗𝘢𝘫𝘢𝘮𝘢𝘴 and taught each other, based on their findings, that the novel is considered a fable. We love that this lesson was mostly student led - nice work! #WhippetPride

post_text: Mrs.Hlad's kindergarten students loved reading the nonfiction big book, 𝙃𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙩𝙨! They learned the difference between nonfiction and fiction books by comparing 𝙃𝙚𝙖𝙧𝙩𝙨 with a fictional book about hearts.💓📖 Mrs. Hlad had this to say, “We are feeling grateful to be in a school district that purchases quality big books, small group reading books and read alouds that help us love learning how to read!” #WhippetPride

post_text: Take a look at these germ free hands!✋🧼 Mrs. Prise’s 1st grade Auburn students had a hand washing lesson from the school nurse, Mrs. Cramer! Students were able to see how many germs were on their hands using “germ lotion” and a black light.🔦 After practicing good hand washing, they checked again and saw remarkably clean results! We’d much rather spread this message, than germs! #WhippetPride

post_text: Lettuce🥗 try to romaine🥬 calm while we show you this awesome garden Mrs. Mullet’s 3rd grade students from Dowds Elementary grew! They harvested cilantro and rainbow chard, some as big as their tiny faces! The class has also successfully grown lettuce, tomatoes, basil, spinach and peppers. The hope is that the tomatoes and basil yield enough to make spaghetti sauce to have a spaghetti lunch for all 3rd grade classes at Dowds.🍝 Thanks to a grant from the Richland County Foundation, our learning has never looked so delicious and fun! #WhippetPride

post_text:
Last week, the Dowds kindergarten through 4th grade students were very busy participating in the Great Kindness Challenge. Their mission was to spread as much kindness as possible! Some of the highlights are listed below:

❤️ Mrs. Finn’s kindergarten class made kindness capes.
❤️ 1st grade made necklaces for their peers.
❤️ 2nd grade wrote kindness letters to the staff and gave compliments to their peers.
❤️ 3rd grade showed appreciation by making hearts to put on staff members doors.
❤️ 4th grade practiced empathy by understanding those who have physical limits.
❤️ Teachers did secret kindness missions with their students.

We LOVE this! #WhippetPride

post_text:
Providing a safe and healthy learning environment for our students and staff is our top priority. Flu season is upon us, and we need your help! You can help us by reminding students to:
🧼Wash their hands with soap often - especially before eating.
🤧Cover their mouths when they sneeze or cough by using their arm; not their hands.
🥤Not share drinks, school lunches or snacks with classmates.
Thank you for helping us keep our schools as germ free as possible. #WhippetPride
